Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing Core Decompression and Vascularized Fibular Grafting for Osteonecrosis of the Femoral Head

Trial_Design.evidence: Each patient's hips were randomly assigned to core decompression or fibular grafting.

Participants.evidence: Conducted at Zhongshan Hospital, Fudan University, from June 2010 to October 2012, this randomised controlled trial included patients with ARCO Stages I-IIIB bilateral osteonecrosis.

Intervention.evidence: Each patient's hips were randomly assigned to core decompression or fibular grafting.

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates core decompression versus vascularized fibular grafting regarding femoral head vascularity, disease progression, and hip function.

Method_Outcome.evidence: SPECT/CT assessed vascularity at baseline, 6, and 36 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was by bilateral hip assignment; allocation concealment and blinding details were not specified.

Blinding.evidence: allocation concealment and blinding details were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Of 51 potential participants, 33 met inclusion criteria, and 27 were randomised.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Six patients were lost to follow-up.

Result_Outcome.evidence: fibular-grafted hips showed higher vascularity than decompression-treated hips (mean difference at 6 months: −27%; 95% CI, −32% to −23%; p < 0.001).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided.
